Account URLsÂ¶

account.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern '' [name='home']>, <URLPattern 'register' [name='register']>, <URLPattern 'login' [name='login']>, <URLPattern 'logout' [name='logout']>, <URLPattern 'profile/update/' [name='update-profile']>, <URLPattern 'profile/create-stripe-account/' [name='create_stripe_account']>, <URLPattern 'profile/change-password/' [name='change-password']>, <URLPattern 'profile/<str:username>/' [name='profile']>, <URLPattern 'history/' [name='history']>]Â¶

URL configuration for the account application.

Each path function specifies a URL pattern and the view that should handle requests to that pattern. Additionally, a name is provided for each URL pattern to make it easier to refer to them in templates and other parts of the application.

Paths: - â€˜â€™ (home): Handles the home page. View: views.home - â€˜registerâ€™: Handles user registration. View: views.register - â€˜loginâ€™: Handles user login. View: views.userlogin - â€˜logoutâ€™: Handles user logout. View: views.userlogout - â€˜profile/update/â€™: Handles profile updates. View: views.update_profile - â€˜profile/create-stripe-account/â€™: Handles creating Stripe accounts for users. View: views.create_stripe_account - â€˜profile/change-password/â€™: Handles changing user passwords. View: views.change_password - â€˜profile/<str:username>/â€™: Displays user profiles. View: views.profile - â€˜history/â€™: Displays user event history. View: views.event_history

client.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'dashboard/' [name='dashboard']>, <URLPattern 'discover/' [name='discover_creators']>, <URLPattern 'subscribe/<str:username>/' [name='select-tier']>, <URLPattern 'subscribe/<str:username>/<int:tier_id>/' [name='subscribe-to-tier']>, <URLPattern 'subscriptions/' [name='subscriptions']>, <URLPattern 'subscriptions/extend/<int:subscription_id>/' [name='extend_subscription']>, <URLPattern 'subscriptions/cancel/<int:subscription_id>/' [name='cancel_subscription']>]Â¶

URL configuration for the client application.

Paths: - â€˜dashboard/â€™: Displays the userâ€™s dashboard. View: views.dashboard - â€˜discover/â€™: Allows users to discover new creators. View: views.discover_creators - â€˜subscribe/<str:username>/â€™: Allows users to select a tier to subscribe to for a specific creator. View: views.select_tier - â€˜subscribe/<str:username>/<int:tier_id>/â€™: Subscribes the user to a specific tier of a creator. View: views.subscribe_to_tier - â€˜subscriptions/â€™: Displays the userâ€™s current subscriptions. View: views.subscriptions - â€˜subscriptions/extend/<int:subscription_id>/â€™: Extends the userâ€™s subscription. View: views.extend_subscription - â€˜subscriptions/cancel/<int:subscription_id>/â€™: Cancels the userâ€™s subscription. View: views.cancel_subscription

Creator URLsÂ¶

creator.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'dashboard/' [name='dashboard']>, <URLPattern 'create-post/' [name='create-post']>, <URLPattern 'tiers/' [name='tiers']>, <URLPattern 'tiers/create/' [name='create-tier']>, <URLPattern 'tiers/delete/<int:tier_id>/' [name='delete-tier']>, <URLPattern 'post/<int:post_id>/delete/' [name='post_delete']>]Â¶

URL configuration for the creator application.

Paths: - â€˜dashboard/â€™: Handles the creatorâ€™s dashboard. View: views.dashboard - â€˜create-post/â€™: Handles the creation of a new post. View: views.create_post - â€˜tiers/â€™: Displays all tiers created by the creator. View: views.tiers - â€˜tiers/create/â€™: Handles the creation of a new tier. View: views.create_tier - â€˜tiers/delete/<int:tier_id>/â€™: Handles the deletion of a tier specified by tier_id. View: views.delete_tier - â€˜post/<int:post_id>/delete/â€™: Handles the deletion of a post specified by post_id. View: views.post_delete

Finances URLsÂ¶

finances.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'purchase/' [name='purchase']>, <URLPattern 'purchase-success/' [name='purchase-success']>, <URLPattern 'withdraw/' [name='withdraw']>]Â¶

URL patterns for the finances application.

This module defines the URL patterns for the views in the finances application, linking URLs to their corresponding view functions.

Patterns: - â€˜purchase/â€™: Links to the purchase_points view, allowing users to purchase points. - â€˜purchase-success/â€™: Links to the purchase_success view, handling the post-purchase process. - â€˜withdraw/â€™: Links to the withdraw_points view, allowing users to withdraw points.

Interactions URLsÂ¶

interactions.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'messages/' [name='direct_messages']>, <URLPattern 'messages/send/<str:username>/' [name='view_thread_with_user']>, <URLPattern 'messages/thread/<int:thread_id>/' [name='view_thread']>, <URLPattern 'like/<int:post_id>/' [name='like_post']>]Â¶

URL configuration for the interactions application.

Each path function specifies a URL pattern and the view that should handle requests to that pattern. Additionally, a name is provided for each URL pattern to make it easier to refer to them in templates and other parts of the application.

Paths: - â€˜messages/â€™: Displays direct messages for the logged-in user. View: views.direct_messages - â€˜messages/send/<str:username>/â€™: Displays a message thread with a specific user. View: views.view_thread - â€˜messages/thread/<int:thread_id>/â€™: Displays a specific message thread by thread ID. View: views.view_thread - â€˜like/<int:post_id>/â€™: Allows the logged-in user to like a specific post. View: views.like_post
